title: Spain and Italy to Play for Davis Cup Trophy
summary: Spain has reached the Davis Cup final for the first time in six years by beating Germany in a close match. They will play against Italy, who are the defending champions. In the semifinal, Spain won the first singles match, but Germany tied it up. Then, Spain's doubles team won the deciding match. Both teams are missing their top players due to injuries, like Carlos Alcaraz for Spain and Jannik Sinner for Italy. The final will be in Bologna, Italy, on Sunday. Spain is excited to compete and try to win the Davis Cup for the seventh time. This is a big event in tennis where countries compete as teams.

background_read: The Davis Cup is an international tennis tournament started in 1900, where national teams compete. It is one of the biggest team events in tennis. Spain has a strong history, having won it six times. Italy is the current champion. Matches include singles and doubles, and teams play in a knockout format. Injuries can affect teams, as seen here with top players missing. This makes the competition exciting and unpredictable.
